item.title: Don't Use Fish Shell
item.description: So, you must have heard the fish shell, which is “a smart and user-friendly command line shell”. I am not those old-school guys who are against new things, but I just want to give a rough analysis of why I don’t use fish as my shell. Metrics of a Good Shell A shell has three main use cases: to run commands and scripts, to write scripts, and to interact with the shell itself.

item.title: I Have a Dream
item.description: We live in a strange world, where path dependence are so strongly manifested in the realm of computers, that both the most performant server clusters and the latest phones runs on operating systems originated more than half a century ago. Going downside, most of the abstraction behind the design of these UNIX or UNIX-like systems cannot make fully usage of modern hardware technologies, rather putting the burden of compatibility on the design of the hardware itself.
